name: Bed surface grain size (pebble count)
functionStatement: Supports aquatic habitats through streambed material and bedform dynamics. Enhances habitat complexity and streambank stability.
descriptionMarkdown: Presence and clarity of expected bedform sequence (riffle-run-pool or step-pool) indicate organized transport and habitat variety.
howToMeasureMarkdown: Perform a pebble count to estimate percent gravel and cobble versus fines.

levels.label: Optimal
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Open interstitial coarse bed with minimal fines.

levels.label: Suboptimal
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Mild embedding or partial fine coverage.

levels.label: Marginal
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Strong embedding or siltation limiting infiltration.

levels.label: Poor
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Predominantly fine or consolidated bed with little interstitial space.

references: high-resolution imagery for bar texture classes (where available).
